content:
I'd really appreciate a point in the right direction here. I just noticed some differences between what I thought were two identical demos of CDS Hooks.

The parameters of the individual service at cds-hooks.org takes a parameter 'hook' while hooks.fhir.me takes 'activity'.

There also seem to be differences in the prefetch of resources and in the format of the URL to the CDS service itself, i.e., example.com/cds-service/{{cds_service_name}} vs example.com/{{ cds-service-name}}/$cds-hook

The demo at cds-hooks.org points to a github page that in turn points to hooks.fhir.me. Is the link to hooks.fhir.me an oversight from an older version?

I presume cds-hooks.org is the more up to date format as those docs have been endorsed here. Is that correct?
Yes, cds-hooks.org is the current place to go for all the data format and API specifications.

Hi Michael, thanks for pointing this out. hooks.fhir.me is the original proposal/version of CDS Hooks. After the January 2016 Connectathon, Josh & myself overhauled it and created the version we're using today (which is reflected on cds-hooks.org. So, you want to look at the version on cds-hooks.org.

I'll scrub any references to hooks.fhir.me that I can find and talk with @Josh Mandel tomorrow about shutting down the server hosting hooks.fhir.me so it doesn't cause more confusion. :-)
